intro: Theopsis trichoclada, commonly known as the velvetleaf gloxinia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Theopsis trichoclada is relatively easy to care for, making it a popular choice among plant enthusiasts.
